query: What specific promises did Britain make to both Arabs and Jews during WWI?
choices: McMahon-Hussein Correspondence (1915) promised Arab independence (including Palestine) for revolting against Ottomans; Balfour Declaration (1917) pledged a Jewish national home in Palestine.
Britain guaranteed Palestine exclusively to Jews in the Sykes-Picot Agreement.
No formal promises existed; both groups misinterpreted diplomatic letters.
Britain promised a binational state with equal power-sharing.
correct_choice: McMahon-Hussein Correspondence (1915) promised Arab independence (including Palestine) for revolting against Ottomans; Balfour Declaration (1917) pledged a Jewish national home in Palestine.
selected_choice_text: McMahon-Hussein Correspondence (1915) promised Arab independence (including Palestine) for revolting against Ottomans; Balfour Declaration (1917) pledged a Jewish national home in Palestine.
context_sources: Palestine Royal Commission (“Peel Commission”) – UK report.pdf

United nations special committee on palestine.pdf
